1_1.readable_text_obs:
In this round of Leduc Hold'em Poker Limit, you are playing as GoodGuy with the player index 1. You are currently in the first game out of a total of 100 games. You started with 100 chips and currently have 50 chips left. Your opponent also started with 100 chips and has 50 chips left. 

In this round, you have been dealt the Queen of Spades. The public card has not been revealed yet. So far, you have put 2 chips into the pot and your opponent has put 4 chips into the pot. 

You are the current player and your legal actions for this turn are to 'call', 'raise', or 'fold'. 

If you 'call', you will match your opponent's bet and put 4 chips into the pot. If you 'raise', you will increase the bet by putting 4 more chips than your opponent into the pot, which would be 8 chips. If you 'fold', you will forfeit the round and lose any chips you have already put into the pot. 

Your best combination now is a single Queen, and potential combinations in the future depend on the public card. If the public card is a Queen, you will have a pair of Queens. If the public card is a King or Jack, your hand will remain as a single Queen. The probability of each scenario will be clearer once the public card is revealed.
